intro: Leandra carassana var. estrellensis, commonly known as the Estrellan leandra, is a rare and ornamental plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, pendulous flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a subtle fragrance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as montane forests, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its leaves are broad and glossy, providing a lush backdrop to its delicate blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
